verses.verse: O Lord, <WH3068> God <WH410> of vengeance; <WH5360> God <WH410> of vengeance, <WH5360> shine <WH3313> forth! <WH3313>
Rise <WH5375> up, O Judge <WH8199> of the earth; <WH776> Render <WH7725> recompense <WH1576> to the proud. <WH1343>
How <WH4970> long <WH5704> <WH4970> shall the wicked, <WH7563> O Lord, <WH3068> How <WH4970> long <WH5704> <WH4970> shall the wicked <WH7563> exult <WH5937>?
They pour <WH5042> forth <WH5042> [words], they speak <WH1696> arrogantly; <WH6277> All <WH3605> who do <WH6466> wickedness <WH205> vaunt <WH559> themselves.
They crush <WH1792> Thy people, <WH5971> O Lord, <WH3068> And afflict <WH6031> Thy heritage. <WH5159>
They slay <WH2026> the widow <WH490> and the stranger, <WH1616> And murder <WH7523> the orphans. <WH3490>
And they have said, <WH559> "The Lord <WH3050> does not see, <WH7200> Nor <WH3808> does the God <WH430> of Jacob <WH3290> pay <WH995> heed. <WH995>"
Pay <WH995> heed, <WH995> you senseless <WH9059> among the people; <WH5971> And when <WH4970> will you understand, <WH7919> stupid <WH3684> ones <WH3684>?
He who planted <WH5193> the ear, <WH241> does He not hear <WH8085>? He who formed <WH3335> the eye, <WH5869> does He not see <WH5027>?
He who chastens <WH3256> the nations, <WH1471> will He not rebuke, <WH3198> [Even] He who teaches <WH3925> man <WH120> knowledge <WH1847>?
The Lord <WH3068> knows <WH3045> the thoughts <WH4284> of man, <WH120> That they are a [mere] breath. <WH1892>
Blessed <WH835> is the man <WH1397> whom <WH834> Thou dost chasten, <WH3256> O Lord, <WH3050> And dost teach <WH3925> out of Thy law; <WH8451>
That Thou mayest grant <WH8252> him relief <WH8252> from the days <WH3117> of adversity, <WH9563> Until <WH5704> a pit <WH7845> is dug <WH3738> for the wicked. <WH7563>
For the Lord <WH3068> will not abandon <WH5203> His people, <WH5971> Nor <WH3808> will He forsake <WH5800> His inheritance. <WH5159>
For judgment <WH4941> will again <WH7725> be righteous; <WH6664> And all <WH3605> the upright <WH3477> in heart <WH3820> will follow <WH310> it.
Who <WH4310> will stand <WH6965> up for me against <WH5973> evildoers <WH7489>? Who <WH4310> will take <WH3320> his stand <WH3320> for me against <WH5973> those who do <WH6466> wickedness <WH205>?
If <WH3884> the Lord <WH3068> had not been <WH1961> my help, <WH5833> My soul <WH5315> would soon <WH4592> have dwelt <WH7931> in [the abode of] silence. <WH1745>
If <WH518> I should say, <WH559> "My foot <WH7272> has slipped, <WH4131>" Thy lovingkindness, <WH2617> O Lord, <WH3068> will hold <WH5582> me up.
When my anxious <WH8312> thoughts <WH8312> multiply <WH7230> within <WH7130> me, Thy consolations <WH8575> delight <WH8173> my soul. <WH5315>
Can a throne <WH3678> of destruction <WH1942> be allied <WH2266> with Thee, One which devises <WH3335> mischief <WH5999> by decree <WH2706>?
They band <WH9075> themselves together <WH1413> against <WH5921> the life <WH5315> of the righteous, <WH6662> And condemn <WH7561> the innocent <WH9345> to death. <WH1818>
But the Lord <WH3068> has been <WH1961> my stronghold, <WH4869> And my God <WH430> the rock <WH6697> of my refuge. <WH4268>
And He has brought <WH7725> back <WH7725> their wickedness <WH205> upon them, And will destroy <WH6789> them in their evil; <WH7451> The Lord <WH3068> our God <WH430> will destroy <WH6789> them.
